column4: If you have a WD external drive, you should see WD icon on your desktop
I don't. It's not being mounted, or even detected as far as I can tell.
on the external harddrive? No. On my computer? Isn't it default included with Ubuntu? I assume it's there, though I haven't used it in a while.
what will I be doing? I can't partition it, it's not my harddrive.
Anyway it doesnt matter since normally WD disks are formatted
I'd love to, but being a student I am not so privledged.
I understand , since I am a student myself.
Do you have another OS on your box?
I have a 5gig partition with tinyxp
no, tinyxp also doesn't see it, which points to hardware problem.
